results.title: Efficacy and safety of atenolol versus propranolol for treatment of infantile haemangioma: A narrative review.
results.text_hl: A total of seven studies comparing the two beta-blockers were identified in our search. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ appeared to be as efficacious as @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and was associated with fewer @DISEASE_Central_Nervous_System_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002493 @@@central nervous system and bronchial@@@-related @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@adverse@@@ events.

citations.NLM: Shi M, Wargon O, Tatian A. Efficacy and safety of atenolol versus propranolol for treatment of infantile haemangioma: A narrative review. Clin Exp Dermatol. 2024 Oct 4;():. PMID: 39365598
citations.BibTeX: @article{39365598, title={Efficacy and safety of atenolol versus propranolol for treatment of infantile haemangioma: A narrative review.}, author={Shi M and Wargon O and Tatian A}, journal={Clin Exp Dermatol}}

results.title: Cognitive function in hypertensives treated with atenolol or propranolol.
results.text_hl: Neither Speilberger's State Trait @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@Anxiety@@@ Inventory nor the Beck @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@Depression@@@ Inventory was affected by either beta blocker. CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ therapy does not impair cognitive function or contribute significantly to @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@psychiatric side effects@@@.

citations.NLM: Palac DM, Cornish RD, McDonald WJ, Middaugh DA, Howieson D, Bagby SP. Cognitive function in hypertensives treated with atenolol or propranolol. J Gen Intern Med. 1990 Jul-Aug;5(4):310-8. PMID: 2197376

results.text_hl: Effect of aged garlic extract and @CHEMICAL_S_allylcysteine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C065299 @@@s-allyl cysteine@@@ and their interaction with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ during @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@ induced @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@myocardial toxicity@@@ in rats

results.title: The effects of extracellular ions on beta-blocker cardiotoxicity.
results.text_hl: Isolated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ hearts were perfused on a Langendorff apparatus with Krebs-Henseleit- Bicarbonate buffer (KHB) solution. @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@Toxicity@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@Tox@@@) was induced by perfusing hearts for 30 min with KHB + @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@PROP@@@ [5 microgram/ml] or KHB + @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@ATEN@@@ [2.5 mg/ml].

citations.NLM: Kerns W 2nd, Ransom M, Tomaszewski C, Kline J, Raymond R. The effects of extracellular ions on beta-blocker cardiotoxicity. Toxicol Appl Pharmacol. 1996 Mar;137(1):1-7. PMID: 8607134
citations.BibTeX: @article{8607134, title={The effects of extracellular ions on beta-blocker cardiotoxicity.}, author={Kerns W 2nd and Ransom M and Tomaszewski C and Kline J and Raymond R}, journal={Toxicol Appl Pharmacol}, volume={137}, number={1}, pages={1-7}}

results.title: Defining the chronic impacts of atenolol on embryo-larval development and reproduction in the fathead minnow (Pimephales promelas).
results.text_hl: These data collectively suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ has low chronic @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@ to fish under the conditions described, particularly considering the low environmental concentrations reported.

citations.NLM: Winter MJ, Lillicrap AD, Caunter JE, Schaffner C, Alder AC, Ramil M, Ternes TA, Giltrow E, Sumpter JP, Hutchinson TH. Defining the chronic impacts of atenolol on embryo-larval development and reproduction in the fathead minnow (Pimephales promelas). Aquat Toxicol. 2008 Feb 18;86(3):361-9. PMID: 18179830

results.title: CNS-related subjective symptoms during treatment with beta 1-adrenoceptor antagonists (atenolol, metoprolol): two double-blind placebo controlled studies.
results.text_hl: A significant @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@adverse effect@@@ on sleep was shown for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ compared with placebo, while no negative effect was observed for @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Dimenäs E, Dahlöf C, Olofsson B, Wiklund I. CNS-related subjective symptoms during treatment with beta 1-adrenoceptor antagonists (atenolol, metoprolol): two double-blind placebo controlled studies. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1989 Nov;28(5):527-34. PMID: 2574052

results.title: Adverse drug reactions induced by cardiovascular drugs in outpatients
results.text_hl: The highest rate of @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@ADRs@@@ was recorded to be induced by @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@Diltiazem@@@ (23.5%) and the lowest rate was related to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ (3%).

citations.NLM: Gholami K, Ziaie S, Shalviri G. Adverse drug reactions induced by cardiovascular drugs in outpatients Pharm Pract (Granada). 2008 Jan;6(1):51-5. PMID: 25170364

results.title: Beta adrenoceptor modulation of the generation of murine cytotoxic T lymphocytes in vitro.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@Butoxamine@@@ (5 X 10(-6) M), a @GENE_BDKRB2 @GENE_12062 @@@beta-2@@@ antagonist, but not @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (5 X 10(-6) M), a @GENE_HBB_B1 @GENE_15129 @@@beta-1@@@ antagonist, blocked the @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@-induced increase in cell-mediated @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@cytotoxicity@@@.

citations.NLM: Hatfield SM, Petersen BH, DiMicco JA. Beta adrenoceptor modulation of the generation of murine cytotoxic T lymphocytes in vitro. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 1986 Nov;239(2):460-6. PMID: 2877082
